resources.string: This project is made in partial fulfillment of requirements of the sixth semester.
This project is made by Pragya Ravindrakumar Mugale, Shreyansh Gupta (1MV20CS105), and Uttam Bindal (1MV20CS120).
\t \t \t \t \t \t \t \t \t \t Boost Your Well-being: \n Explore, Meditate, and Learn with Our App
Break tasks into smaller, manageable chunks. This will help you feel less overwhelmed and more in control.
Use productivity techniques like the Pomodoro Technique. This involves working in short bursts of 25 minutes with 5-minute breaks in between.
Practice effective study strategies. This could include creating organized study schedules, using mnemonic devices, or finding a study buddy.
Establish a consistent sleep schedule. Aim for going to bed and waking up at the same time each day, even on weekends.
Create a relaxing bedtime routine. This could include taking a warm bath, reading a book, or listening to calming music.
Keep your sleep environment comfortable, quiet, and dark. This will help you fall asleep more easily and wake up feeling refreshed.
Start with short mindfulness exercises. These could include focused breathing or body scans.
Practice mindful eating. This means savoring each bite and paying attention to the flavors, textures, and sensations of your food.
Incorporate mindful walking into your daily routine. Pay attention to the sensations of each step and the environment around you.
Prioritize quality over quantity in friendships. Focus on cultivating a few meaningful connections rather than trying to please everyone.
Set healthy boundaries. Learn to say no when necessary and don\'t overcommit yourself.
Seek support from trusted friends or campus support services. If you\'re feeling overwhelmed or experiencing social anxiety, reach out for help.
Find activities that bring you joy. Make time for these activities regularly, whether it\'s practicing a hobby, spending time in nature, or listening to music.
Take breaks throughout the day to recharge. This could involve stretching, deep breathing, or practicing mindfulness exercises.
Practice self-compassion. Be kind to yourself, acknowledge your accomplishments, and treat yourself with the same care you would give to a friend.
